intro: Hieracium phaeocomoides, commonly known as the dark-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are dark green and have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium phaeocomoides is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable habitats.
